references.paper_title: Gromov-Wasserstein alignment of word embedding spaces
references.reason: This paper introduces the Gromov-Wasserstein distance, a crucial concept for measuring the distance between distributions and aligning embeddings which is central to the Procrustes-Wasserstein problem.

references.paper_title: A method for registration of 3-D shapes
references.reason: This paper introduces the Iterative Closest Points (ICP) algorithm, a fundamental technique for aligning point clouds which is adapted to higher dimensions for the Procrustes-Wasserstein problem.

references.paper_title: Unsupervised alignment of embeddings with Wasserstein Procrustes
references.reason: This paper proposes a state-of-the-art method for the Procrustes-Wasserstein problem, which the current paper aims to improve upon by providing informational results and computational guarantees.

references.paper_title: Strong recovery of geometric planted matchings
references.reason: This paper provides information-theoretic results on the related problem of planted matching in geometric graphs, which helps to understand the fundamental limits of the Procrustes-Wasserstein problem.

references.paper_title: Random graph matching in geometric models: the case of complete graphs
references.reason: This paper studies the related problem of geometric graph alignment, which shares similarities with the Procrustes-Wasserstein problem and offers insights into its theoretical properties.
